meanings.def: an informal term for a lightweight straw Panama hat
a brimmed hat woven from toquilla straw, traditionally made in Ecuador
a rubber or silicone nipple given to infants for sucking
a lightweight tent sized to carry in a backpack
a bag carried on the back by shoulder straps
a small wireless device that signals the bearer to return a call or read a short message
an open-topped container with a handle, used for carrying liquids or loose materials
the amount that fills such a container
meanings.example: He carried a pail of water to the garden.

meanings.def: a flat section forming part of a surface, door, or wall
a group of people gathered to give advice, judge, or discuss a topic
a control surface filled with switches, gauges, or displays
garments that cover the body from waist to ankles with a separate section for each leg
meanings.example: He ironed his dress pants before the interview.

meanings.def: underwear worn next to the skin below the waist, especially in British English
a public area of land kept for recreation and relaxation
meanings.example: Families gathered in the park for an evening picnic.

meanings.def: an extensive tract of protected natural land
meanings.example: The national park preserves miles of alpine forest.

meanings.def: a stadium or field where professional baseball is played
meanings.example: They built a new park to host the city's expansion team.

meanings.def: the transmission position that locks a vehicle in place
meanings.example: She shifted into park before turning off the engine.

meanings.def: to bring a vehicle to a stop and leave it temporarily
meanings.example: We parked near the museum entrance.

meanings.def: a compact grand piano built for use in living rooms or small performance spaces
a compact grand piano built for domestic settings
a small grand piano designed for private homes
a small grand piano sized for drawing rooms
a motor vehicle primarily designed to carry people
a small piece of material used to cover and protect a wound
a protective covering worn over an injured or healing eye
a piece of fabric or other material sewn over a hole to mend it
a defined area that differs in appearance or composition from its surroundings
meanings.example: A bright patch of sunlight warmed the floor.

meanings.def: a small plot of ground supporting particular plants
meanings.example: They weeded the herb patch behind the kitchen.

meanings.def: a software update that fixes problems in an existing program
a short, often difficult, period of time
meanings.example: The company went through a rough patch before sales rebounded.

meanings.def: to repair by applying or sewing on a patch
meanings.example: She patched the tear in her jacket.

meanings.def: to apply a software update to an existing program
meanings.example: The administrator patched the servers overnight.

meanings.def: a police vehicle used for patrolling streets
a wooden or metal overshoe worn to raise the foot above mud or wet ground
the cargo or instruments carried by a vehicle, especially the useful load of a spacecraft or missile
a ceremonial tobacco pipe used by some Indigenous peoples of North America
the pointed top of a mountain or similar height
meanings.example: Snow covered the mountain peak year-round.

meanings.def: the highest or most intense level of something
meanings.example: Ticket demand reached its peak on opening weekend.

meanings.def: the stiff visor on the front of a cap
to reach the highest point or value
meanings.example: Harvest season peaks in early September.

meanings.def: a base that supports a column, statue, or similar structure
a supporting foundation for something upright
meanings.example: The lamp sat on a marble pedestal.

meanings.def: a position of high admiration or idealization
meanings.example: Fans placed the singer on a pedestal after the benefit concert.

meanings.def: a short decorative covering placed across the top of a window curtain
a sealed bag used to transport a deceased person's body
a tall lighthouse that guides or warns ships
a drink or remedy taken to restore energy or alertness
meanings.example: She ordered a strong coffee as a midafternoon pick-me-up.

meanings.def: something that quickly improves mood or vitality
meanings.example: A walk in the sunshine was just the pick-me-up he needed.

meanings.def: an ornate movie theater, especially from the early twentieth century
the most outstanding or memorable item in a collection or event
meanings.example: The dessert was the piece de resistance of the meal.

meanings.def: a small compartment for sorting or storing papers or messages
to classify someone or something too narrowly
meanings.example: Critics pigeonholed the novelist as a mystery writer.

meanings.def: a tall vertical support of stone, wood, or metal
an enduring source of support or stability
meanings.example: Education is a pillar of their community plan.

meanings.def: a removable fabric cover for a pillow
a removable fabric cover that encases a pillow
a slender pointed piece of metal or wood used to fasten or secure things
a large wooden target used in bowling
the flagstick that marks the hole on a golf green
a move in which a wrestler holds an opponent's shoulders to the mat
to fasten or attach with a pin
meanings.example: She pinned the corsage to her jacket.

meanings.def: to hold someone or something so it cannot move
meanings.example: Rescuers pinned the tarp against the frame until help arrived.

meanings.def: in chess, to immobilize a piece because moving it would expose a more valuable piece
meanings.example: The bishop pinned the knight to the king.

meanings.def: the meshed gears in a vehicle differential that transfer power from the driveshaft to the axle
the pair of spiral gears in a differential that change the direction of drive to the axle
a toy consisting of a wheel of light vanes that spins in the wind
the hollow top of a smoking pipe that holds burning tobacco
a ceremonial tobacco pipe used to mark agreements or gatherings
a black flag bearing a skull-and-crossbones emblem flown by pirates
a large hole or cavity in the ground
meanings.example: They filled in the pit after the repairs were done.

meanings.def: the stone of a drupe fruit such as a peach or cherry
the area in front of a stage reserved for musicians or fans
an enclosure where certain trades or activities take place, such as on a trading floor
to remove the stone from a piece of fruit
meanings.example: She pitted a bowl of cherries for the pie.

meanings.def: civilian attire worn by police officers instead of a uniform
a flat tablet or plate inscribed to commemorate a person or event
a sticky film of bacteria that forms on teeth
an abnormal patch of tissue inside or on the surface of the body
a gauze strip coated with plaster of Paris for forming casts
a rigid dressing made of plaster or fiberglass that holds a broken bone in place while it heals
a flat dish from which food is served or eaten
home plate, the base a batter stands beside in baseball
a rigid layer of the Earth's crust that moves slowly over the mantle
a thin sheet of metal, glass, or other solid material
a removable dental appliance that replaces missing teeth
a shallow vessel passed to collect offerings in a religious service
the positive electrode in a vacuum tube
a main course served on a single dish
meanings.example: She ordered the seafood plate for dinner.

meanings.def: to coat a surface with a thin layer of metal
meanings.example: They plated the ring with rhodium to prevent tarnish.

meanings.def: a raised surface used for standing, performing, or loading
the declared set of policies of a political party or candidate
a base of software or hardware on which applications run
a boat used for recreation rather than work or transport
a vessel operated for leisure activities
a hard felt hat with a rounded crown and narrow brim
a software component that adds a specific capability to an existing program
designed to connect directly to a socket for use
meanings.example: They bought a plug-in heater for the office.

meanings.def: a pressurized watertight chamber used to build foundations below water
a small portable lighter designed to be carried in a pocket
a small handbag for carrying cash and everyday personal items
meanings.example: She tucked her keys into the pocketbook before leaving the house.

meanings.def: a folding case for money and cards
an individual's financial resources
meanings.example: The renovation was too much for their pocketbook this year.

meanings.def: a woman's bonnet with a deep projecting brim tied under the chin
a small disc used to represent money in gambling games
a motor vehicle outfitted for police officers on duty
a patrol car equipped for routine police work
a tool or machine that buffs a surface to a smooth shine
a tapered stick used to strike billiard balls
a cue stick used to play billiards or pool
a small bunch of flowers, often given as a gift
a small cosmetic case with face powder and a mirror
a covered wagon used by settlers traveling the North American prairies
a large covered wagon once used by settlers crossing the North American plains
a pointed tool used to start holes for small nails or screws
a small room in which a prisoner is confined
a square enclosure where professional boxing matches take place
the central unit in a computer that interprets and executes instructions
a device or company that treats raw materials or data
meanings.example: The plant operates as a major soybean processor.

meanings.def: equipment designed to prevent disease or pregnancy
a medication sold under a trademarked brand name while under patent protection
the front section of a ship or boat above the waterline
a police car assigned to cruise an area on patrol
to move or raise something with a lever or force
meanings.example: They pried the lid off the crate.

meanings.def: to inquire too closely into someone's private affairs
meanings.example: Reporters tried to pry into her personal life.

meanings.def: a metal bar with a flattened end used to force objects apart
a small bag for carrying money, cards, and personal necessities
meanings.example: She always keeps hand sanitizer in her purse.

meanings.def: a wallet or small case for holding cash
prize money awarded in a competition
meanings.example: The tournament purse drew top-ranked players from around the world.

meanings.def: available financial resources
meanings.example: The city opened its purse to repair the aging bridges.

meanings.def: to press the lips together into a rounded shape
meanings.example: He pursed his lips while considering the offer.

meanings.def: to draw together so that small folds form
meanings.example: Moisture caused the pages to purse along the edges.
